intro: Lobivia schneideriana var. carnea, commonly known as the pink lobivia, is a compact, slow-growing cactus native to the arid regions of Argentina. It features cylindrical stems that are typically pink to reddish in color, often with a velvety texture. The plant produces small, vibrant flowers in shades of pink or red during the spring and summer months. It is well adapted to full sun and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements, it is favored by succulent enthusiasts.
